item.title: Tidy Processes in Python
item.description: The subprocess module from the Python standard library makes it easy to start processes from within your Python script. But, it gets more complex if: You need to run the subprocess concurrently with your script The subprocess creates its own child processes In my case, I had a Flask server that needed to be running while my experiment script ran since my script made API calls to the server.
